pros: Great work place if you are motivated and enjoy an independent work environment.
cons: For being a place of education there is a lack of training for support staff.

pros: Great work environment with lots of paid professional development opportunities. Larimer campus art department keeps the same schedule from semester to semester- no waiting until 2 weeks before class starts to find out when you'll be working. There is ample free parking.

pros: Helping students choose careers they enjoy.

review_title: The most rewarding student work available.

pros: Autonomy, Respect, Professional Development Opportunities

pros: The coworkers in my department were great.

review_title: Great part time job for students

pros: Got to do homework when I wasn't working on projects. They respected my hours as a student and schedules were flexible.

pros: Get to help people through some of the most difficult classes.

pros: Good opportunity to enter into a full-time career at front range IT tech staff.

job_title: Fulltime Faculty in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Teaching at a community college is very rewarding. Great colleagues and students.
cons: The budget has been very tight with student numbers down in the COVID years and the jobs numbers increasing. This has made the college not fill all vacancies and demand more of employees.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Fort Collins, CO
pros: The college employs diverse and interesting people well connected to the community.
cons: Micro management starting way at the top has the college tripping over its own feet. Red tape has stifled the agility it once had.

pros: FRCC is one of the best schools I have worked at. My lead, Chelsea Stow, is a great mentor, colleague, and ally. She helps part time instructors to achieve their goals. She is one of the nicest people and so helpful. The students are so nice and it feels like a community on campus. I personally enjoy my interactions with the students here. There is also step pay and paid professional development that is very useful for those interested in engaging teaching practices.
cons: The pay is low compared to MSU or DU. Colorado in general has not had a raise increase at the instructor level to match the cost of living.

job_title: Work Study in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Wonderful campus full of wonderful people.
cons: Nothing negative to say about FRCC.

review_title: Good experience for those passionate about subjects
pros: Learn a lot and interact with students/teachers
cons: The pay is low but this is expected in education

pros: It's a great way to help pay for an education while gaining workforce skills that can be applied to a full-time job later. My supervisor was extremely friendly and patient even when I made mistakes.
cons: Remote Working was lonely - not too much team camaraderie from other student co-workers on Zoom.

review_title: Meaningful work but system does not allow for appropriate compensation

pros: I love working for FRCC

review_title: Great community and highly motivated students!
pros: Front Range has a supportive, professional community of educators. Class sizes are small and the students here are generally highly motivated.
cons: I can't think of any!

review_title: The job was oversold as IT technician, but was more of customer service.
pros: Flexibility of hours and an immediate manager whom wanted to hear my opinion about the work place and to listen to suggestions.  Some suggestions were acted on and improvements for training in the department were implemented.
cons: Wages not realistic for a student employee.  They have not kept up with inflation;a student employee was better of in the 1980;s on minimum wage versus. the 21st century minimum  wage.  A dollar a decade increase - really?

review_title: Great place to build relevant experience
job_title: Technical Assistant in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Works with your school schedule
cons: COVID-19 happened and so they really didn't know how to keep us all busy.

review_title: A Good Preliminary Student Work Experience.
pros: Flexible scheduling that accommodated for class schedule.
cons: Leadership was questionable and sometimes challenging to work with.

pros: Very fun department to work in and full of great people. This department often partakes in happy hours and lively holiday parties.
cons: The pay is terrible. There is not a lot of opportunity for raises and there has not been a lot of growth in the role.

job_title: Physics Instructor in Fort Collins, CO
pros:
Great learning environment.
Freedom to design curriculum within state standards.
Professional development opportunities
cons:
Little room for growth.
Lack of appreciation for part-time instructor feedback.

pros: Management, work life balance, annual leave
cons: Limited opportunities for growth, salary

job_title: Campus Security Officer in Longmont, CO
pros: Easy and very good pay for your responsibilities.
cons: The job looks like a police related position but it is not. Kind of boring.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Great Culture and room for growth.
cons: Organization can be challenging and communication is difficult at times.

pros: Flexible, Great work environment, Friendly
cons: Low pay, not a lot of opportunity to grow

pros: Benefits are better than normal
cons: Pay is lower than normal

review_title: Don't get trapped in the Adjunct Hell!
pros:
Better than not working.
Adds experience to your resume.
If you're a teacher in between jobs, it counts towards your retirement.
New students each semester makes the class constantly new.  They're the only good thing about the place.
Dept chair mostly stays out of my way--not that I need supervision, just nice not to be hovered about.
Once you've developed your course, you're good to just to do little updates for each semester.
cons:
Talk about second-class citizens!  Adjunct are treated much worse than students--who are the paying customers.
You get a class, Yay!, but then you're stuck with it.  It's hard to switch, other teachers think you're mooching on their classes.
Loss of benefits.  We used to get so much more.  Now, I'm only there, because they haven't decided I'm all used up yet.
Full-time faculty treat you like you're a transient, even if you have your 10-year service award.
Keep cutting pay.  Cuts, cuts, cuts!  There's nothing left to cut.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Fort Collins, CO
pros:
- Exceptionally laid back and easy going position for an individual looking to potentially further their teaching career or possibly go back for a Pd.D
- Small classroom settings give you the opportunity to not be overwhelmed even when teaching difficult subject matter
- Not much micro managing by departments which is fantastic. They let you do the teaching, and let you come to them if their are issues
cons:
- Extremely low pay which is to be expected from a Community College
- Low Pay + Difficult Subject matter is not conducive to stress levels as a professor
- Very hard to jump right into a teaching position while have to learn the very minute details of the computer system, grading schemes, HR department, and eWolf
- Good luck if jumping into a full-time teaching role for the first time. Be prepared to have EVERYTHING ready a good 2 weeks before classes start

review_title: FRCC - overall, a good place to be...
pros: Front Range Community College is a place where all employees work for the good of the students!  The atmosphere here is one of learning and collaboration.  Overall, it is one of the best places to work.
cons: I don't have anything negative to say about Front Range Community College as a whole.  There is a saying that most people leave their current position because of their immediate supervisor.  Yes, that happens here...but you can move on to another position within, which is a good thing working for the State and FRCC.

pros: Great faculty (adjunct and full time), Good hands on experience in a various departments as a work study, encouraging and enriching environment to work in while pursuing a degree. Overall, just a wonderful community of diverse individuals who are there to help each other succeed.
cons: The cafeteria could be better (need more vegetarian/vegan options), would also be nice if work study was not limited to 20 hours a week. Perhaps look into expanding  the amount of work study positions within individual departments (i.e. Chemistry, biology, geology, physics, astronomy) to compensate for an ever expanding science program at FRCC

review_title: Only good if your a regular employee
job_title: Corporate Tax Intern in Westminster, CO
pros: Entry level, lenient, and help with homework time
cons: Temporary as work studies do not get much priority and regular employees treat you like garbage

pros: Students are hard working and dedicated. Prof development is better than at most cc's
cons:
As was mentioned in a previous review "The President's leadership is weak, which has enabled many nasty personality types to take over and cause harm to subordinates. HR is not helpful, and often harmful to employees. 
Faculty of a certain age are forced out. This has been happening for over 10 years.  Admins play favorites and are advanced to leadership positions.  HR complaints are ignored because HR is there to " protect the college" ......yes they say this  outright at the faculty meetings.

pros: The ladies at Front Range do a great job helping students prepare to get jobs after graduation. They also help students pick degrees that are going to make them money in the long run.
cons: The pay is quite minimal for the amount of work that it takes to make graphic design materials. I also have a maximum of only 20 hours a week which I can work.

review_title: Poor Leadership Affecting Employees and Ultimately Students
pros: The campus in Fort Collins is nice. There are nice, updated buildings which are conducive to learning. The exterior campus area is well-kept.
cons: As was mentioned in a previous review "The President's leadership is weak, which has enabled many nasty personality types to take over and cause harm to subordinates. HR is not helpful, and often harmful to employees. The effective faculty have, in large part, left the college. Bringing new ideas to the table (by staff) is, at best, not encouraged, and other times completely ignored. Loyalty is demanded, but not returned nor rewarded. Solid contributions and accomplishments unrecognized by leadership." These thoughts hit the nail on the head. FRCC has become an unhealthy environment for students and faculty.

review_title: Adjunct Instructors are second or third class citizens
pros: The students work hard. The instructors really care about teaching.
cons: Being a contingent worker with no say and low pay is exhausting. It's especially demeaning to have to prepare lessons AND pay for ones own substitute if Ill. The severe limit on number of courses assigned to avoid paying benefits is past humiliating.

pros: The students were great, my colleagues were really nice
cons:
The pay was the lowest I've ever received for tutoring
There wasn't any time paid for any kind of preparation. I was just supposed to come in and tutor. No planning whatsoever.
Too much time needed to be spent on administrative duties for tutoring and I wasn't paid for this time.

pros: At FRCC people have tremendous respect for one another, and everyone's input is heard. Most people are deeply committed to the mission of our college, and is motivated to help students and each other any way they can. The current movement to become a "Pathways" college is especially inspiring. It's refreshing to see a college change quickly and prudently.
cons: Limited upward mobility and pay isn't great. However no one works in education for the pay!

pros: Great environment, supportive staff.  This is a community college, like many others, that tried to support graduation rates and the community around it.
cons: Like any other community college adjunct instructor position, this does not pay very well.  This position is a good CV builder.

pros: You get to know so many people around campus, making it feel like a small community.
cons: Working at the satellite campus NE of the Fort Collins main campus, gets pretty boring during class times.

review_title: I have worked with them for six years and as salary for state is frozen, haven"t had a raise
job_title: Adm Assist in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Working with students trying to improve their level in life
cons: Very structured community college atmosphere with little attention to needs of students and more to keeping job security and levels of control

pros: Phenomenal place to work.  Management in my department were amazing.  Rewarded outstanding work.  Called people out who weren't up to par.
cons: Hard to change existing processes.  Innovation requires jumping through red tape.  Not specific to FRCC, but working for the state can occasionally be frustrating.

pros: You can set your own hours, as long as you work a minimum number of hours per week. Students are great to work with - what a variety!!
cons: Pay could be better, but who wouldn't say that about their jobs??

review_title: Welcoming community of faculty that loves their job and respects students.
job_title: Part Time Adjunct Instructor in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Health insurance and retirement benefits. Room for advancement and raises are disseminated properly. Treated like a human being by higher up.
cons: The only way to add to your class list is by commuting to other campuses, or wait for another instructor in your department to leave.

job_title: Lead Graphic Designer in Westminster, CO
pros: Front Range hires students in many different departments so they can gain experience in their field of study. The hours are flexible and do not exceed 20 hours per week.
cons: The pay is low and working in such a large institution leaves a lot of room for disorganization. Triage is not always handled appropriately.

review_title: Best place to work for a computer science student
job_title: Senior Student Technician in Longmont, CO
pros: Great people working together to make the campus a better place and giving students the drive to succeed.
cons: Lots of red tape, but that's to be expected.

pros: Good experience working in an educational environment with several very intelligent people. It was a lot of fun discussing games in education.
cons: Low pay. Occasional lack of communication and organization. Making progress was sometimes slow and uncertain.

pros: There are absolutely no pros for this organization, steer clear
cons: Abusive and hostile work environment.  Committee selections are based on a desired outcome with absolutely no goal of objectivity and independence which is why they are called bobblehead committees.  If you voice an independent opinion  you are accused of failure to collaborate.   Do not trust human resources staff.

pros: HR is a great place to help people and get experience.
cons: You'll find every reason to change careers after the bad taste they leave in your mouth. Your all important until your unimportant.

job_title: Adult Educator in Fort Collins, CO
pros: CAL's staff is supportive, smart, and sensitive. We have an amazing supervisor who encourages us to be better teachers and helps us refine our skills via relevant PD.
cons: No benefits for part-time teachers.

pros: Great place to get a chance if you're a student.   Aside from this there are no redeeming qualities.
cons:
Poor Pay
No Benefits
Politics ---- Front Range Community College is ALL politics.  
Management is terrible and have always allowed bad instructors to get away with anything.
